page.title: 19Gt.Walsingham
page.content: Nestled down by the quiet River Stiffkey,Great Walsingham has a population of 480.There has been a post office for over 75 years.We also have 2 churches,{St.Peters}and a{ {Methodist Chapel}.There are three farms in the village.I live next to one.There is the stump of an old windmill.We think there is the flint base of an old watermill.There are the remains of the first flint church.There are two village greens,one has a lot of lovely flowering cherry trees.On the other outside{Berry Hall}grows a{Restoration {oak}.Berry Hall was at one time a partly fortified manor house.It used to be moated.The ladies who run it have a lot of foster children.Near the green with the cherry trees stands a foundry. by Neil Halls Age 11.
